info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 3 at 3:59PM PDT until October 3 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Tulare including the Northern Portion of the Coffee Pot burn scar.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 358 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.1 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coffee Pot burn scar, Three Rivers, Ash Mountain Sequoia Park HQ and Case Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING
